programs.program_name: Diploma in Financial Technology + UK Final Year Degree (University of Northampton)

entry_requirements_raw.SPM: Min. 3 credits in any subjects including Mathematics and a pass in English.
entry_requirements_raw.O-Level: Min. 3 credits in any subjects including Mathematics.
entry_requirements_raw.STPM: Min. a Grade C in any subjects.  Pass SPM with a credit in Mathematics and a pass in English

course_content.core: Common Core: Business Ethics Business Law Supply Chain Management Information System for Business Business Data Communication Introduction to Microeconomics Introduction to Macroeconomics Introduction to Business Communication Financial Accounting Calculus and Algebra Introduction to Management Introduction to Marketing Quantitative Methods Discipline Core: Introduction to Finance Financial Management Principles of Investment Financial Modelling Personal Financial Planning Introduction to FinTech Introduction to Blockchain FinTech Governance FinTech Project Business Statistics Compulsory Subjects: Fundamentals of Innovation and Entrepreneurship Introduction to Digital Marketing Industrial Training: Industrial Training for FinTech

SPM.text: Min. 3 credits in any subjects including Mathematics and a pass in English.

O-Level.text: Min. 3 credits in any subjects including Mathematics.

STPM.text: Min. a Grade C in any subjects.  Pass SPM with a credit in Mathematics and a pass in English

programs.program_name: Diploma in Digital Business + UK Final Year Degree (University of Northampton)

entry_requirements_raw.STPM: Min. a Grade C in any subjects.

course_content.core:
Common Core Business Ethics Organisational Behaviour Fundamentals of Innovation and Entrepreneurship Introduction to Digital Business International Business Business Process Management Introduction to Business Communication Information System for Business Introduction to Microeconomics Introduction to Macroeconomics Financial Accounting Introduction to Finance Introduction to Management Introduction to Human Resource Management Introduction to Marketing Quantitative Methods  Discipline Core Business Law Introduction to E-Commerce Supply Chain Management Business Application Development Digital Business Project Business Data Communication Cybersecurity Decision Support Systems Introduction to Digital Marketing  Industrial Training Industrial Training for Digital Business  *Mata Pelajaran Umum (MPU) Falsafah dan Isu Semasa Integrity and Anti-Corruption Character Formation Service Learning Bahasa Kebangsaan A
For local students who do not have credit in SPM BM For local students who do not have credit in SPM BM Bahasa Melayu Komunikasi 1
For international students For international students  NOTE: *MPU: The Ministry of Higher Education (MOHE) requires all students to take Mata Pelajaran Umum (MPU) (i.e. General Studies) within the duration of their studies. MCKL established a series of subjects that different programs need to implement for all students to meet the Ministry’s requirements. Subjects will differ depending on the institution and the level of degree the student is taking.

programs.program_name: Diploma in Computer Science + UK Final Year Degree (University of Northampton)

entry_requirements_raw.SPM: Min. 3 credits including Mathematics and a pass in Bahasa Melayu and Sejarah (History).
entry_requirements_raw.STPM: Min. a Grade C in any subjects.  Credit in Mathematics at SPM level or its equivalent

course_content.core:
Core Computer Organisation and Architecture Fundamentals of Database Discrete Mathematics Calculus and Algebra Data Communications and Networking Computers and Operating Systems Programming with Python Systems Analysis and Design Statistics** Cybersecurity Professionalism and Ethics in Computing  Discipline Core Design Thinking Human Computer Interaction Project Management Data Structure and Algorithms Mobile Computing Web Computing Object-Oriented Development Cloud Computing  Specialisation Fundamentals of Data Science** Data Processing and Visualisation** Introduction to Data Mining** Machine Learning** Big Data Architecture  Industrial Training  Capstone Project  ** Uses SAS content and software.  *Mata Pelajaran Umum (MPU) Falsafah dan Isu Semasa Integrity and Anti-Corruption Character Formation Service Learning Bahasa Kebangsaan A
For local students who do not have credit in SPM BM For local students who do not have credit in SPM BM Bahasa Melayu Komunikasi 1
For international students For international students  NOTE: *MPU: The Ministry of Higher Education (MOHE) requires all students to take Mata Pelajaran Umum (MPU) (i.e. General Studies) within the duration of their studies. MCKL established a series of subjects that different programs need to implement for all students to meet the Ministry’s requirements. Subjects will differ depending on the institution and the level of degree the student is taking.

entry_requirements_raw.STPM: Min. Grade C in any subjects.

course_content.core:
Core Child Development Behavioural Guidance of Children Foundations of Early Childhood Education Creative Expressions Through Music and Movement Language and Early Literacy Creative Expressions Through Art and Drama Physical Education for Young Children Programme Planning and Implementation Observation and Assessment of Young Children Infant and Toddler Care Teaching Social Studies to Young Children Play in Early Childhood Education Partnership with Families and the Community Teaching Mathematics to Young Children Introduction to Early Childhood Educational Research Children with Special Needs Foundations of Professional Practice Early Childhood Education Standards and Approaches Child’s Health, Safety and Nutrition Technology in Early Childhood Education Entrepreneurship and Early Childhood Administration English Enhancement Pedagogies in Early Childhood Education  Practical Practicum I: Block Practice in Childcare Centre (TASKA) Practicum II: Block Practice in Preschool/ Kindergarten (TADIKA)  *Mata Pelajaran Umum (MPU) Falsafah dan Isu Semasa Integrity and Anti-Corruption Character Formation Service Learning Bahasa Kebangsaan A

programs.program_name: Australian Matriculation (AUSMAT)

course_content.core: August intake may be subject to higher fees. Please check with our counsellors to confirm

programs.program_name: Australian Matriculation (AUSMAT)

entry_requirements_raw.Others: ICCE General Certificate - Min. 80% in 5 subjects.

course_content.core: Students are required to select a combination of 5 ATAR courses or 4 ATAR + 1 General Subject from the list below with at least one course from List A and one course from List B. Students will also need to select 1 language course. Compulsory Subjects: Service Learning Character Formation List A (Arts/Languages/Social Sciences) Business Management and Enterprise Economics English/General English *English as an Additional Language/Dialect (EALD) List B (Mathematics/Science/Technology) Accounting and Finance ^KL ^KL Applied Information Technology ^KL ^ KL Biology ^KL ^KL Chemistry Human Biology Mathematics Applications Mathematics Methods Physics Psychology Online Literacy And Numeracy Assessment (OLNA): Numeracy Reading Writing NOTE: *Evidence is required to be produced for EALD eligibility (less than 7 years of English medium education). ^KL – Subjects offered in Kuala Lumpur Campus only. ^KL ATAR courses are only offered in January & June intakes. General subjects and Human Biology (ATAR course) are only offered in the June intake. August intake students will need to re-register their courses in the subsequent January semester allowing them to choose different course combination depending on the course requirement. The ONLA is an online assessment designed to enable students to successfully meet the Western Australian Certificate of Education (WACE) requirement of demonstrating the minimum standard of literacy (reading and writing) and numeracy. The ONLA
